pullRequest.body:
The embedding of `Type` into `Cat`, which views a set as a discrete category, is left adjoint to the functor `Cat.objects : Cat -> Set` mapping a category to its set of objects


---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

nodes.body:
### PR summary [2d3f7aab41](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/15375/commits/2d3f7aab417b677bd40bdac53f0f1bf66f2a4608)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.CategoryTheory.Category.Cat.Adjunction`|313|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

`+ typeToCatObjectsAdj`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

Thanks for your contribution! Instead of leaving a bunch of comments throughout your code, I decided to make a suggestion of how to rewrite the whole file (it's the same proof, I just removed a few unnecessary auxiliary definitions, simplified a few proofs and so on). 

A couple of general remarks first:
- You should read the [naming convention](https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/naming.html).
- Use the `where` syntax when applicable.
- Free variables should come before the colon instead of under a `forall`¬†quantifier when possible.
- Use proper indentation (this is probably described in the [style guide](https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/style.html), but it should also be clear from my suggestions.

Here is my suggestion on how the file should look. I hope it's helpful and doesn't discourage you from contributing more in the future!

```lean
/-
Copyright (c) 2024 Nicolas Rolland. All rights reserved.
Released under Apache 2.0 license as described in the file LICENSE.
Authors: Nicolas Rolland
-/
import Mathlib.CategoryTheory.Adjunction.Basic
import Mathlib.CategoryTheory.Category.Cat
/-!

# Adjunctions related to Cat, the category of categories

The embedding `typeToCat: Type ‚•§ Cat`, mapping a type to the corresponding discrete category, is
left adjoint to the functor `Cat.objects`, which maps a category to its set of objects.

## TODO

Define the left adjoint `Cat.connectedComponents` to `typeToCat: Type ‚•§ Cat`, which maps a
category to its set of connected components.
-/

universe u

namespace CategoryTheory.Cat

variable (X : Type u) (C : Cat)

private def typeToCatObjectsAdjHomEquiv : (typeToCat.obj X ‚ü∂ C) ‚âÉ (X ‚ü∂ objects.obj C) where
  toFun f x := f.obj ‚ü®x‚ü©
  invFun f := Discrete.functor f
  left_inv F := Functor.hext (fun _ ‚Ü¶ rfl) (fun ‚ü®_‚ü© ‚ü®_‚ü© f ‚Ü¶ by
    obtain rfl := Discrete.eq_of_hom f
    simp)
  right_inv _ := rfl

private def typeToCatObjectsAdjCounitApp : (objects ‚ãô typeToCat).obj C ‚•§ C where
  obj := Discrete.as
  map := eqToHom ‚àò Discrete.eq_of_hom

/-- `typeToCat : Type ‚•§ Cat` is left adjoint to `Cat.objects : Cat ‚•§ Type` -/
def typeToCatObjectsAdj : typeToCat ‚ä£ objects where
  homEquiv := typeToCatObjectsAdjHomEquiv
  unit := { app:= fun _ ‚Ü¶ Discrete.mk }
  counit := {
    app := typeToCatObjectsAdjCounitApp
    naturality := fun _ _ _ ‚Ü¶ Functor.hext (fun _ ‚Ü¶ rfl) (fun ‚ü®_‚ü© ‚ü®_‚ü© f ‚Ü¶ by
      obtain rfl := Discrete.eq_of_hom f
      aesop) }

end CategoryTheory.Cat

```

Thank you for this feedback !

I found on my own that `where` is cleaner, and didn't see your comment before pushing again.

I will read it carefully now
Hopefully that's ok now

Thanks!

maintainer merge
üöÄ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by dagurtomas.

Thanks!

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10262706345/job/28392940752)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10262706345/job/28392939876)
See my comment above
The file you're adding should probably live in the folder `CategoryTheory/Cat`¬†and be called `Adjunction.lean`

```suggestion
  left_inv F := Functor.ext (fun _ ‚Ü¶ rfl) (fun ‚ü®_‚ü© ‚ü®_‚ü© f => by
    obtain rfl := Discrete.eq_of_hom f
    simp)
  right_inv _ := rfl
```
Could you rename this in a similar way to the auxiliary definition for the counit?
You should use backticks around the code in the docstring
I made some suggestions to rephrase the module docstring in my first comment. Could you take a look at those and try to incorporate them?
I think this should all be in the namespace `CategoryTheory.Cat`¬†

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(CategoryTheory/Adjunction): `typeToCat`¬†is left adjoint to `Cat.objects`
